virtual const char* Hypertable::Range::get_split_row (  )  [inline, virtual]

Returns a split row for this cell list.

This should be an approximation of the middle row key in the list.

Returns:
the split row key

String Hypertable::Range::end_row (  )  [inline]

Returns the end row of the range.

Returns:
the end row of the range
This does not need to be protected by a lock because the end row of a range never changes.

block updates

unblock updates

The following code ensures that pending updates that have not been committed on this range do not get included in the compaction scan

Definition at line 597 of file Range.cc.

void Range::split_install_log ( Timestamp *  timestampp,
String &  old_start_row 
) [private]

If we didn't get at least one row from each Access Group, then try again the hard way (scans CellCache for middle row)

cout << "Dumping split rows for " << m_identifier.name << "[" << m_start_row << ".." << m_end_row << "]" << endl; for (size_t i=0; i<split_rows.size(); i++) cout << "Range::get_split_row [" << i << "] = " << split_rows[i] << endl;

If we still didn't get a good split row, try again the *really* hard way by collecting all of the cached rows, sorting them and then taking the middle.

Create split (transfer) log
